page.title: 12OAKLEY NATURE TRAIL
page.content: {You could tell it was old because it {was very crumbly. It had little holes {so it had woodworm. There was a kind {of powder inside with some little {things like flies under it. I found a {log which looked like a horse foot. {It is 150 years old. I counted the {rings. I did a bark rubbing. The {bark was green, yellow, black and {brown. In the magnifying glass I saw {woodlice cases. Spiders eat insects {like woodlice. Shane gave me a thing {that a wasp made. It is like a rotten {apple. I got stung by a stinging {nettle. The good thing about stinging {nettles is butterflies lay their eggs {on them. We saw fungus on trees and {toadstools. One of them was smaller {than my little finger. }Plans for Oakley include a permanent camping area, adventure playground, swimming pool and Youth Hostel.
